sen.j: 他国衆とは、戦国大名の領国。
sen.e: Takokushu is a territory of daimyo in the Warring States period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Takokushu is a territory of daimyo in the Warring States period.
Takokushu is a territory of Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period [period of Warring States]).
sen.cmt: 大名の説明を補足しました。

sen.j: そして、大名の本拠がある本国以外に領地を認められている有力武家の事。
sen.e: It also refers to an influential samurai family who was admitted to have a territory other than their main property.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It also refers to an influential samurai family who was admitted to have a territory other than their main property.
It also refers to an influential samurai family who was admitted to have a territory other than their main property in one's own province.

sen.j: あるいは、戦国大名が直轄支配する本国以外の勢力地である他国の国衆（国人）のこと。
sen.e: Or it refers to kunishu (kokujin [local samurai]) who lived in other region where was under the influence of daimyo in the Warring States period other than their directly-controlled main territory.
Or, it refers to kunishu (kokujin [local samurai]) who lived in other region which was under the influence of daimyo other than their directly-controlled main territory in the Warring States period.
Or, it refers to local samurai who lived in other region which was under the influence of daimyo other than their directly-controlled main territory in the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: 国衆（国人）は英語表記に変更しました。
